name: SAPA
mission: Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a not-for-profit, scientific professional, non-partisan, and humanitarian membership-based organization established in January 2019
theoryOfChange: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) has a documented strategic approach to its work. Their strategy is described as a "comprehensive, holistic approach to healthcare delivery" aimed at ensuring vulnerable groups, particularly women and children, receive accessible and quality healthcare. SAPA's overarching humanitarian goals include ensuring access to essential healthcare services, preventing and controlling communicable diseases, providing food assistance, supporting health facilities, strengthening local healthcare worker capacity, and fostering collaboration among humanitarian organizations. Their programming framework includes pillars such as Direct Health Service Delivery, Health System Resiliency, WASH, Food and Nutrition, and Protection, designed to increase disaster response capacity and build resilience. A Mid-2024 Report outlines a "framework for SAPA's programming moving forward" with an overarching goal for all targeted individuals to "survive and thrive" by 2026, benefiting from early nurturing, care, education, and reliable access to high-quality health and nutrition interventions. SAPA also implements a quality assurance framework that includes staff training, supervision, regular reporting, and partner-supported logistics. The organization's commitment to transparency regarding its goals, strategies, and achievements is further evidenced by its 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid.

evaluationSources: 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

score_details.score_summary: Sudanese American Physicians Association shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SAPA holds a 97.0/100 rating and focuses on building core healthcare functions to respond to crises.
The organization provides specific donation methods for supporters to contribute to their mission.
SAPA is Zakat-eligible and maintains a policy regarding Zakat distribution and asnaf categories.
In 2023, SAPA reported total revenue of $3,502,228 and operated programs for hunger relief and emergency services in Sudan and Chad.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall rating due to its direct impact on global health crises and its exceptional financial transparency and Zakat-eligible status.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding working capital beyond 4.3 months to enhance long-term sustainability during protracted regional conflicts.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and humanitarian aid, particularly within a Muslim donor context due to its Zakat-eligible status and clear asnaf category policies [2][3]. The urgency of the cause is high given the ongoing crises in the regions SAPA serves [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAPA demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of medical services and hunger relief, maintaining a program expense ratio of 81.2% [1][4]. With total revenue of $3,502,228, the organization efficiently manages resources to support healthcare systems in high-conflict zones [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare infrastructure and provides life-saving emergency services to communities in crisis across Sudan and Chad.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.2%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support healthcare and relief initiatives.
Exceptional financial efficiency with a fundraising cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised.
Strong accountability and transparency, reflected in a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100.
baseline_narrative.summary: SAPA works with local health providers and institutions to build resilient healthcare systems capable of responding to humanitarian emergencies [1]. The organization operates critical programs including healthcare services, hunger relief, and emergency response in Sudan and Chad [4]. SAPA is recognized as Zakat-eligible, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure contributions reach those in need [3].

Zakat is distributed to eligible categories

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall rating due to its direct impact on global health crises and its exceptional financial transparency and Zakat-eligible status.

areas_for_improvement.context: While program ratios are high, SAPA could <cite id="7">publish consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for more precise cost-per-beneficiary assessments.
Expanding services to <cite id="7">additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage could further improve its alignment score.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high standards of accountability and financial reporting.

case_against.mitigation_notes: SAPA mitigates these risks through strong local partnerships and a resilient 9.5-month cash reserve.
risk_factors: <cite id="5">founded in 2019</cite>, making it a younger organization than many peers
Operating in regions with <cite id="8">extreme political instability</cite>
case_against.summary: Limited concerns exist, primarily centered on the organization's <cite id="5">relatively short track record</cite> and the inherent risks of operating in conflict zones.

confidence.notes: Very high confidence due to recent audited financials and Platinum transparency seal.

known_gaps: Missing specific beneficiary counts for cost-effectiveness analysis

alignment.explanation: SAPA is a <cite id="3">verified zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving <cite id="8">Muslim-majority regions</cite> like Sudan and Chad, addressing high-urgency global health needs.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be maximized by <cite id="7">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAPA due to its <cite id="1">97/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and its <cite id="11">audited financial statements</cite> which confirm rigorous fiscal oversight.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, SAPA could pursue formal BBB Wise Giving Alliance accreditation.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with <cite id="1">81.2% of expenses</cite> (by CN metrics) or up to <cite id="4">100.0%</cite> (by 990 metrics) directed to programs, supported by <cite id="1">4.3 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="7">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to facilitate cost-effectiveness analysis.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation through local medical staff

rich_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare infrastructure and provides life-saving emergency services to communities in crisis across Sudan and Chad.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide direct medical relief to Muslim communities in active conflict zones through a highly transparent, physician-led organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat with a high-transparency organization
Prioritize healthcare and emergency medical infrastructure
Value organizations with low fundraising overhead
Specifically care about the humanitarian crisis in Sudan
giving_considerations: High growth stage means the organization is rapidly evolving
Direct service model in conflict zones carries high operational risk
Strong financial health suggests long-term sustainability
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those looking for domestic US-only community development.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects verified outcomes and a strong theory of change, though cost-per-beneficiary data is not yet fully public.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAPA works with local health providers to build core functions of a healthcare system prepared to respond to crises.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions actually reduce mortality and improve health outcomes in crisis zones.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive scale of the Sudanese humanitarian crisis far exceeds current funding levels.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="6">263.1% revenue growth</cite> and specialized focus on the Sudanese healthcare crisis.

strengths.detail: SAPA maintains a <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> according to its latest filings, with a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization has earned a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
SAPA's leadership is supported by a <cite id="1">81.2% independent board</cite> and has achieved perfect scores of <cite id="1">100 in both Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons.

strengths_deep_dive: SAPA's operational excellence is anchored in its <cite id="1">97.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite>, which highlights its commitment to transparency. Financially, the organization is highly resilient, maintaining <cite id="1">4.3 months of working capital</cite> to sustain operations during volatile periods. Its impact is further validated by the tracking of <cite id="10">13 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid, ensuring that healthcare delivery is not just frequent, but effective. The organization's ability to scale from a small non-profit to a <cite id="4">$3.5 million operation</cite> in just a few years demonstrates significant organizational capacity and trust from the donor community.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a specialized humanitarian organization that <cite id="1">strengthens healthcare infrastructure</cite> and provides life-saving emergency services to communities in crisis. Founded in <cite id="5">2019</cite>, SAPA has rapidly scaled its operations to address the deteriorating humanitarian situation in Sudan and neighboring Chad. The organization reported <cite id="4">$3,502,228 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, representing a remarkable <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>. This growth reflects its critical role as a primary responder in conflict zones where healthcare systems have largely collapsed. SAPA operates through a model of <cite id="7">direct provision</cite>, working with local health providers to ensure essential services—including reproductive health and emergency medical care—remain accessible to displaced populations. Beyond immediate medical aid, the charity manages <cite id="8">Hunger Relief and WASH programs</cite> to address the social determinants of health in refugee settings. As a <cite id="3">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, SAPA provides a verified channel for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations by supporting the <cite id="9">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> in high-urgency conflict regions.
